title: After ‘Productive’ Call, Trump Plans Another Meeting With Putin
summary: President Trump has come close to imposing penalties on Russia several times, only to backtrack after talking with President Vladimir Putin and raising hopes for a diplomatic solution to the war.

title: Meet the Designer Who Got Zelensky Into a Suit
summary: Viktor Anisimov, one of Ukraine’s top fashion designers, first met Volodymyr Zelensky about 20 years ago, when the future president was a comedian. He didn’t want to wear a suit then either.

title: What Are Tomahawk Missiles, and Why Might Trump Give Them to Ukraine?
summary: Ukraine could receive a newly developed land-based launcher to strike Moscow and beyond.

title: Trump’s 2-Hour Call with Putin, and Why Iran Is Pushing Gender Transition Surgeries
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: 7 Takeaways From the First N.Y.C. Mayoral Debate
summary: Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa sparred over serious topics like the Israel-Hamas war and President Trump, and more curious subjects like parade attendance.

title: The Top Zingers of the Mayoral Debate
summary: The two-hour slugfest produced some memorable one-liners, on subjects ranging from the candidates’ parents to imaginary sports championships.

title: Mayoral Candidates Spar Over Trump, Qualifications and the Q Train
summary: The first New York City mayoral debate among Andrew Cuomo, Zohran Mamdani and Curtis Sliwa covered a minefield of political issues, both global and hyperlocal.

title: Fact-Checking the Debate
summary: Zohran Mamdani, Andrew Cuomo and Curtis Sliwa traded barbs over the police, prostitution and President Trump.

title: John Bolton Indicted Over Handling of Classified Information
summary: Mr. Bolton, a Trump aide turned critic, is part of a string of presidential foes to become prosecutorial targets. But his case gained momentum in the Biden administration.

title: How the Bolton Indictment Compares to Trump’s Classified Documents Case
summary: Some charges against the onetime national security adviser resemble the dropped case against President Trump, but there are also differences.

title: After ‘Horrors,’ Israeli Hostages Taste Freedom and Savor Family Reunions
summary: Some former captives have been sent home from the hospital. But a doctor said they all had “endured untold adversity,” as details emerge of their time in Gaza’s tunnels.

title: What’s Next for the Gaza Cease-Fire Plan
summary: Israel and Hamas have reached a cease-fire deal in Gaza, but the hard part starts now. David Sanger of The New York Times describes the major obstacles to further agreement about Gaza’s immediate future.

title: Trump Warns Hamas of Strikes if Violence in Gaza Continues
summary: The president later clarified that the United States would not be involved in such an action.

title: Where Does the Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Stand?
summary: Unresolved issues — mainly over the exchange of the remains of hostages and prisoners — threaten to destabilize the fragile agreement.

title: U.S. Says Louisiana Man Joined Hamas-Led 2023 Attack on Israel
summary: A man was in custody after federal prosecutors accused him of joining Gazan militants in attacking Israel on Oct. 7, 2023. He was also accused of lying to obtain a U.S. visa.

title: Military Commander Overseeing Escalating Attacks Off Venezuela Coast Is Stepping Down, Officials Say
summary: Adm. Alvin Holsey is leaving less than a year into his tenure, and as the Pentagon escalates attacks against boats in the Caribbean Sea.

title: Psychological Warfare in Venezuela
summary: We examine the Trump administration’s tactics against Venezuela.

title: Trump Refiles $15 Billion Lawsuit Against The New York Times
summary: A federal judge had previously dismissed the complaint as unnecessarily lengthy and digressive. The president claims that The Times sought to defame him during the 2024 election.

title: What We Know About the Latest ‘No Kings’ Protests Amid Government Shutdown
summary: The nationwide protests are playing out as a federal government shutdown lingers and troops are being deployed in cities.

title: An Internet Shutdown Cuts Off Iranians From One Another, and the World
summary: Since its brief June war with Israel, Iran has throttled internet traffic and jammed GPS, making day-to-day tasks online almost impossible and prompting Iranians’ fears of greater surveillance.

title: ICE Deported a Teen and Her Mother. Devastation Met Them in Guatemala.
summary: ICE deported 17-year-old Nory Sontay Ramos and her mother. Devastation met them in Guatemala.

title: Salesforce Offers Its Services to Boost Trump’s Immigration Force
summary: The San Francisco-based firm has told ICE that it could use A.I. to help the agency nearly triple its staff. The company’s C.E.O., once a progressive tech titan, has embraced President Trump.

title: The Growing Blowback Against Marc Benioff
summary: New revelations about efforts by his company, Salesforce, to work with the Trump administration is getting heat from San Francisco officials and now allies.

title: Lady Gaga Was Always Gothic. Now the World Has Caught Up to Her.
summary: At a moment when other pop stars are flirting with dark spectacle, Gaga’s “Mayhem” tour shows that she has perfected it.

title: ‘You Could Treat a Child for a Few Dollars.’ Now Those Clinics Are Gone.
summary: Hunger and the diseases that stalk small children have surged in Somalia after the U.S. slashed its aid to the country.

title: A Somali Hospital Closed After U.S. Aid Cuts. Fired Employees Reopened It Without Pay.
summary: After the Trump administration stopped funding a medical center for women and children, a determined group of health care workers refused to let it shutter.

title: Universities Are Standing Up to Trump
summary: A White House proposal for special funding treatment crossed a line for several schools. Some say it feels like a turning point in the federal government’s battle with higher education.

title: Indiana University Fires Adviser to Student Newspaper and Bars Print Publication
summary: The administration at Indiana University Bloomington fired the adviser to the paper and barred the publication from putting out a print edition.

title: How Cedric Grolet, an Internet-Famous Pastry Chef, Built a Dessert Empire
summary: Cedric Grolet has built a dessert empire in just a few short years. Crowds are already swarming his new chocolate shop in Paris.

title: ‘The Only Candidate With a Coherent Vision’: 3 Opinion Writers on the Mayoral Debate
summary: Who lost the debate may be clearer than who won.

title: How Baby Boomers Blew Up the American Dream
summary: The postwar generation had a good run. Now we’re all paying for it.

title: Apple, Caught Between U.S. and China, Pledges Investment in Both
summary: In Beijing this week, the company’s chief executive, Tim Cook, made promises similar to ones he’d made at the White House. He also got a custom Labubu.

title: Instagram Unveils Teen Safety Features for A.I. Chatbots
summary: Instagram is introducing parental controls and limits to conversations on topics like self-harm as concerns grow over how A.I. chatbots affect mental health.

title: Tomiichi Murayama, Japanese Leader Who Gave War Apology, Dies at 101
summary: His televised address as prime minister, delivered 50 years to the day after Japan announced its surrender, set a marker for his country’s “deep remorse” over wartime atrocities.

title: Book Review: ‘Nobody’s Girl,’ by Virginia Roberts Giuffre
summary: Virginia Roberts Giuffre’s posthumous “Nobody’s Girl” doesn’t break political news, but might break your heart.
